page.title: 13RECREATION IN AMBLE
page.content: The root of{Amble's recreational activities is the hard-working, hard- drinking,{male-dominated society}of the{nineteenth century. The men}who helped{to export the coal and fished from the port{worked hard}and established{a working-class community. The{public houses and churches}were the focal point of society.{Warkworth meanwhile retained its more {traditional character,}while{Amble}in the{second half of the 20th century saw a{greater involvement of women}in the{social activities of the town.}The movement towards{physical fitness in {the 1980s}has seen an interest in {outdoor and physical pursuits.}The town is looking towards{recreation}as {a source of income}with the decline of the traditional industries.{Tourism}is growing, with{a caravan site}already established and a{proposed marina.
